context: Tests whether the agent uses rule-oriented format for independent search constraints, includes comprehensive negative/edge cases, and creates measurable criteria for search behavior and results.

checklist.name: Rule-oriented format
checklist.description: Uses rule-oriented checkbox format for independent search requirements rather than Given/When/Then

checklist.name: Comprehensive edge cases
checklist.description: Includes negative scenarios like empty results, invalid input, timeout, special characters

checklist.name: Input validation rules
checklist.description: Specifies search input limits, character restrictions, and format requirements

checklist.name: Measurable result limits
checklist.description: Includes specific numbers for result counts, pagination, or display limits (e.g., 'max 20 results per page')

checklist.name: Performance timing
checklist.description: Specifies measurable timing requirements for search execution (e.g., '<= 2 seconds')

checklist.name: Error handling scenarios
checklist.description: Covers failure cases like no results found, search timeout, or system unavailability

checklist.name: Result formatting rules
checklist.description: Specifies how search results should be displayed, sorted, or formatted

checklist.name: Checkbox validation format
checklist.description: Uses checkbox format (- [ ]) to enable clear pass/fail validation of search criteria

checklist.name: Independent requirements
checklist.description: Each search requirement can be tested independently without dependencies

checklist.name: User outcome focus
checklist.description: Focuses on what users experience during search rather than backend implementation details
